reqs:
Co-reqs: All of FNEL 281, FNEL 282, FNEL 389. (Corequisites can be taken either alongside or prior to FNEL 482.)
Equivalents:
courseName: Applied Research in Endangered Language Reclamation
description: Application of research skills and methodologies in the design and implementation of a research project relevant to endangered language conservation and/or revitalization. Project co-constructed in collaboration with a First Nations community, guided by community-based ethical protocols. FNEL 481 recommended.
